learning_outcomes.description: Identify appropriate methods for statistical analyses from a descriptive scenario.
Demonstrate a foundational knowledge of statistical methods by carrying out simple statistical procedures by hand.
Use statistical software appropriately and confidently for exploratory data analysis and to make relevant statistical conclusions.
Effectively and appropriately communicate insights from data as evidence within an engineering context.

assessments.task_description:
In each week (Weeks 8 - 13) there will be a quiz to complete online. Each quiz will open at 9:00am on Monday and must be completed by the due date. There is no set duration for the quizzes.

Most quizzes will involve analysing data using Python. This will be an important opportunity to learn how to perform data analysis with Python. You are encouraged to discuss issues using the Ed Discussion Board.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quizzes are accessed via Blackboard. An unlimited number of attempts is allowed for each quiz question. Questions are marked automatically. There is no separate submission procedure.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Problem Set involving problem solving, analysis, visualisation and interpretation.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item through the link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. The final examination will cover all the material in the course. The exam paper will come with a formula sheet and statistical tables. You will need an approved calculator for use in the exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 13(02 Sep - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Each week we aim to cover one unit from the course notes. The units are (1) Visualise, summarise, and clean data, (2) Random variables and expectations, (3) Distribution of the sample mean, (4) Inference for a single mean, (5) Comparing two means, (6) Linear regression models.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Each week we aim to cover one unit from the course notes. The units are (1) Visualise, summarise, and clean data, (2) Random variables and expectations, (3) Distribution of the sample mean, (4) Inference for a single mean, (5) Comparing two means, (6) Linear regression models.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 8 To Week 13(09 Sep - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

The tutorials are an opportunity to practice the ideas covered in the lectures by working through exercises with other students and the tutor. Each tutorial will cover one unit from the course notes.
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials The tutorials are an opportunity to practice the ideas covered in the lectures by working through exercises with other students and the tutor. Each tutorial will cover one unit from the course notes.
